content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Sure, here is an example how you could implement this:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    new_list = String[]
    for word in words
        if length(word) > 0 && word[1] == uppercase(word[1])
            push!(new_list, word)
        end
    end
    return new_list
end
```
In this function, we check each word. If the first character is a capital letter (checked with `uppercase(word[1])`), we add it to `new_list`. Note that in Julia, indexing starts from 1, so we use `length(word) > 0` to avoid an error if there's an empty string or whitespace at the beginning of our word list. After all words are checked, we return `new_list`.
